title: Ticket #948: DaemonCore::Reset_Timer code needs inspection
description:
DaemonCore::Reset_Timer calls directly to TimerManager::ResetTimer. Documentation says ResetTimer returns 0 on success and -1 if the timer is unknown. The current code for ResetTimer returns -1 properly and 0 on success OR if the timer is registered with a timeslice in which case the reset attempt is ignored.

NOTE: This special casing for timeslice suggests that time slices are implemented too low in the TimerManager. A time slice should be layered, and this test mostly serves as one way to protect against improper use of a time slice. A better approach would be a first class timer id and time slice, to prevent misuse of a time sliced timer id as if it were a regular timer id.

The return value of Reset_Timer is ignored almost everywhere (157 total uses), exceptions:

  • gahp-client.cpp - returned from reset_user_timer, mixed with TRUE/FALSE, and then ignored
  • vm_gahp_request.cpp - returned from resetUserTimer, mixed with TRUE/FALSE, and then ignored
  • daemon_core.cpp - checked for failure (ASSERT) in HandleChildAliveCommand when resetting timer for HungChildTimeout
  • cronjob.cpp - returned from KillTimer and then ignored
  • admin_event.cpp - used to set m_timeridDoShutdown, but buggy and not worth saving, e.g. return value is conflated with Register_Timer return value
  • note: also in eventd[.V2], which doesn't count and is used improperly

HandleChildAliveCommand is the only proper use of a Reset_Timer return value. The check serves as a sanity check against DaemonCore's implementation of Timers. It checks to see if it has registered a timer that DaemonCore still knows about it, e.g. DC has not lost it and no one has cancelled it without resetting the recorded timer id.

The uses of Reset_Timer's return value should be reduced to only HandleChildAliveCommand's, and then the decision should be made as to if the return value should be removed entirely.

NOTE: CancelTimer's return value is also suspect. It returns if the timer was found or not. CancelAllTimers returns nothing.
